idsDocument.documentation:
A Facility represents a physical plot of land that may be owned, bought, sold, or leased. This IDS can be used to load the base level Facility information such as physical location, owner, contact methods and name.
Note: Due to the hierarchy nature of locations within a facility, please use FacilityLocation to organize all relevant physical/logical structures within the Facility. For example, using FacilityLocation will allow you to specify a Room, the Floor the room resides on, and the ward that floor is associated with. From a data warehouse perspective this information will be available in a hierarchy orientation.

element.name: MasterId
element.documentation: Links this instance to the master. This value is created and updated by the Omni matching service.

element.name: PreMergeSurvivor
element.documentation:
There are often scenarios in a given source system where multiple instance records may be created that represent the same logical entity. At some point the source system may detect this issue and would like to convey that information to the processing server.
Use this element to indicate the surviving entity when multiple instances represent the same entity. This element will be used during the matching and merging process to insure that entity instances are properly grouped.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of facility being loaded. For example Hospital, Parking Garage, Administrative Building, etc...

element.name: Name
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the name of the Facility. This should be the primary name of the Facility and if it's known by other names they can be stored in the identifiers collection.

list.name: Addresses
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify one or more addresses used by this Facility. Any given facility may have multiple address locations such as Loading Dock, Administrative, etc...

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this specification to load Facility address information into Omni.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of address being loaded.

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Specify the date this address became active.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: Specify the date this address becomes inactive.

element.name: PreferenceOrder
element.documentation: This field is for an entity having multiple addresses, indicates which is the 'most preferred' (lowest number) to 'least preferred' (highest number).

element.name: AddressLine1
element.documentation: This field specifies the street or mailing address of a person or institution. When referencing an institution, this first component is used to specify the institution name. When used in connection with a person, this component specifies the first line of the address.

element.name: AddressLine2
element.documentation: This field specifies the second line of address. In general, it qualifies address. Examples: Suite 555 or Fourth Floor. When referencing an institution, this component specifies the street address.

element.name: AddressLine3
element.documentation: This field specifies the name of the person or organization that should appear as part of the address. This is also known as the "Care of" or "C/O" line.

element.name: AddressLine4
element.documentation: This field specifies more address information.

element.name: City
element.documentation: This field specifies the city, district or place where the addressee is located depending upon the national convention for formatting addresses for postal usage.

element.name: StateProvince
element.documentation: This field specifies the state or province where the addressee is located. State or province should be represented by the official postal service codes for that country.

element.name: PostalCode
element.documentation: This component specifies the zip or postal code where the addressee is located. Zip or postal codes should be represented by the official codes for that country. In the US, the zip code takes the form 99999[-9999], while the Canadian postal code takes the form A9A9A9 and the Australian Postcode takes the form 9999.

element.name: Country
element.documentation: This component specifies the country where the addressee is located. HL7 specifies that the 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 be used for the country code.

element.name: CountyRegion
element.documentation: This component specifies the county where the addressee is located when applicable.

element.name: UsageComment
element.documentation: Descriptive information about the use of the address. Example : "Do not ring bell"

element.name: Latitude
element.documentation: Contains the Latitude.

element.name: Longitude
element.documentation: Contains the Longitude.

list.name: Identifiers
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify the list of identifiers for this Facility. For example Block, Lot #, etc...

idsSpecification.name: FacilityIdentifier

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this structure to specify identifiers for a Facility.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the type of identifier. For example Block Number, Lot Number, etc...

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date the identifier became active.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date the identifier becomes inactive.

element.name: Value
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the value of the identifier.

element.name: IssuingAuthority
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the Organization that was responsible for issuing this identification.

element.name: Comment
element.documentation: Use this element to store comments about the identifier.

list.name: ContactMethods
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify the list of email, phone number, fax number, and other contact methods generically associated with this Facility.

idsSpecification.name: FacilityContactMethod
idsSpecification.elementOrder: Type, StartDate, EndDate, PreferenceOrder, Protection, Value, UsageComment

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this collection to specify one or more contact methods for a patient. For example you may specify multiple email, phone, or fax numbers. This document can only be used within a Patient.Identifiers element.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: Use this element to specify what type of contact method is being described. i.e. Email, Phone, etc..

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Specify the date this contact method became active.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: Specify the date this contact method became inactive.

element.name: PreferenceOrder
element.documentation: For a patient having contact methods, indicates which is the 'most preferred' (lowest number) to 'least preferred' (highest number).

element.name: Protection
element.documentation: Identifies that the contact method needs to be treated with special care or sensitivity.

element.name: Value
element.documentation: Identifies the value of the contact method.

element.name: UsageComment
element.documentation: Defines the usage comment. Such as 'After 5pm'

list.name: Relations
list.documentation: Use this collection to specify personal and business relations for this Facility. For example you may specify Owner, Leasee, Occupant, Maintainer, etc...

idsSpecification.name: FacilityRelation

include.name: CommonElements
include.appendToElementOrder: ExtendedAttributes, SourceStatusCode, SourceCreatedDate, SourceCreatedBy, SourceModifiedDate, SourceModifiedBy

idsSpecification.documentation: Use this collection element to specify Personal or Organizational relationships to the Facility.

element.name: Type
element.documentation: This field contains the actual relationship that the associated party has to the Facility.

element.name: StartDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date the relation became active.

element.name: EndDate
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the date the relation becomes inactive.

element.name: Relation
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the link to a related Person or Organization.

element.name: RelatedTo
element.documentation: Use this element to specify the link to a related Person or Organization.
